greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of partitions of n into sum of at most three primes.
comment: a(n) = A010051(n) + A061358(n) + A068307(n). [From _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Aug 08 2009]
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..10000
mathematica: While[n<=Length[parts], If[Intersection[Flatten[PrimeQ[parts[[n]]]]][[1]]==True, count++]; n++]; count); Table[goldbachcount[i], {i, 1, 100}] (* _Frank M Jackson_, Mar 25 2013 *)
Table[Length[Select[IntegerPartitions[n,3],AllTrue[#,PrimeQ]&]],{n,90}] (* The program uses the AllTrue function from Mathematica version 10 *) (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Oct 21 2016 *)
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 19 2002
